result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pierre J. Daniel

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath in court for Pierre J. Daniel. Defendant Pierre J. Daniel in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Hertz-Mcgrath advises she just got a new offer and needs to discuss it with the DE. The DE is also waiting for his revocation hearing on another matter.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pierre J. Daniel in court, in custody.  Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath in court for Pierre J. Daniel.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
The HE of 09/15/22 at 10:30 is removed from the calendar. Commissioner Keating to hear motion filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 471533,
Payable Number: 347940,
Receipt Number: 22R 024265,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant, Pierre J. Daniel, appeared with Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Hertz-McGrath was just retained and requests an adjournment.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Motion filed to dismiss, scheduled currently with Br 2.   Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Due to the Motion to Dismissed that was filed a HE has been set with Attorney Solis to 09/15/22 at 10:30.

Attorney Alexis Sell appears under the supervision of Atty Emily Gaertner. Attorney Xavier Solis in court with Defendant Pierre J. Daniel who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Atty Solis states he was just appointed to this case and needs time to prepare.  DE waives time for a preliminary hearing; therefore, time limits are tolled for cause.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  *No Weapons especially firearms.

02:09 PM 
  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 8/9/22  @ 915am.  PO Hold.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
